alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:04PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Grant County through 200 PM CDT... At 103 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Muscoda to 8 miles southeast of McGregor. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Muscoda around 110 PM CDT. Lancaster around 135 PM CDT. Platteville and Cuba City around 200 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Preston, Arthur, Highway 61 And County T, Montfort, Mount Ida, Beetown, Union, Cornelia, County Roads K And T and Porters Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in La Crosse.
